column4: I am having a whole lot of trouble with Ubuntu installation media. 3 of my four discs (ubuntu server, ubuntu alternate, and a Swedish ubuntu remix) based on 9.10 all hang up halfway through the installation requesting that i put the correct disc in the tray (which I obviously already have)
and I cant boot liveusbs... cant even find the .img files anymore
are there no official ubuntu .img?
well i have used unetbootin on three different flashdrives
with the iso files
and it fails to start up the installer every time

The usual reason for it not finding the CD it booted from is that it doesn't know what driver to use for the motherboard chipset controlling the IDE/SATA bus the CD drive is attached to. Sometimes you can modprobe it in if you know which you need
but the Live CD's boot up and the installation works about halfway through the package installation process
Yes, that symptom fits the problem I described
so you're saying i should modprobe the drivers when the installation error occurs?
No, prior to beginning the install process
The usual two chipsets this works on require either the sata_mv (marvell chipset)  or the sata_via
thanks! will try that..
nforce chipset has another that I forget the module name offhand
tried loading both the via and the marvell modules
Do you have an external USB CD drive? I usually would try from that
i do not :( i have usb sticks but for some reason they refuse to boot Ubuntu
What says result of:  lspci | grep ATA   ?
Intel controllers
ICH7, ICH9, what?
seems to be a problem with NEC drives (which I have one)
Ah, OK. Sometimes I found with ICH9/10 that you need to set in bios for it to use ahci mode as well
yeah gonna check my bios settings too
(on my Asus P5K SE for instance)
